title: One cup wonder
body:
I recently purchased the espresso machine and have been quite pleased with its overall performance. The ease of use and the availability of espresso pods make my morning routine much simpler. The one-cup coffee option is ideal for my quick caffeine fix, but I did run into a minor setback with cup size compatibility.

While I appreciate the convenience of the one-cup feature, I found that not all of my coffee cups fit under the spout. Unfortunately, only a few of my cups can slide comfortably beneath it, meaning I often have to resort to using my smaller cups. This limitation does affect the user experience, especially if you prefer larger mugs for your espresso shots.

Another slight inconvenience is the grounds option, which is tailored for a single cup of coffee as well. However, I was hoping for a pod option here too, similar to the espresso pod setup. Having both options consistent would have added more convenience to the machine's functionality.

Despite these minor downsides, I still find the machine's performance satisfactory. The ease of use and the availability of espresso pods significantly outweigh the limited cup size compatibility and the lack of a pod option for ground coffee. Overall, I would recommend this espresso machine to those who prioritize convenience and are willing to work around the cup size constraints.

body:
****UPDATE****
It has been since about May when I bought my Kotlie. Now an honest review of my experience.
First the good and then the bad.
It is definitely worth the money. For my first machine, it does so many things. For an espresso, the small tank lasts for a long time. It let's me know when it is hot enough and when it is gonna start making espresso/coffee. It is small and compact so it doesn't take up much room like my Kuerig does. It does produce a small amount of foam and it will make espresso/hot liquid in a short amount of time. We mainly use it for espresso, but because of the little "drawers" we have used K-Kups and even made hot loose leaf tea! Also, you can put a regular sized coffe cup underneath or hold a travel mug. All of this for less than $100! Again! It is well worth the price.

Now the downside.
After making espresso/hot liquid drinks, it drips excessively even after you remove the coffee. I don‚Äôt know where the coffee liquid comes from. To make a doppio it takes a little work and you have to be careful that the dripping coffee doesn't drip on your clothes. It also takes some time to get it to stop dripping enough to remove the container so you can add another. It does heat fast so you don't have to wait after you put a new Pod in it to make more. You can use various cup sizes, but you must remove the drip tray, tip the container to get the drink in your cup. That is all I can think of now. It is still worth the money and I would buy one for a gift. My desire is to use this one for a long time and then move up to a more fancier and more costly one, but this one I'd really good for new espresso machine buyers or those on a tight budget or those that travel often and would like to take their machine with them instead of drinking the hotel coffee. I am very happy with with my first espresso machine

This first one, my first espresso maker and I was excited, brewed one cup! One! Thank goodness, though the bottom had puncture holes, it did not break through the attached inner filter nor put the holes in the top. I went 4 pods before I gave up. I called Amazon and that day returned to UPS and had my refund. Before that, I ordered another. I figure with the good reviews that I should give it another shot. I had to wait several more days to get the new one. I first made a cup with a new pod, then the 2nd with the used (unused) ones and it worked the 2nd time. I also made a cup for my daughter tonight before she went to work with one of the other used ones and with the 3rd cup, it still worked good. I am still holding my breath on this one and if anything changes, I hope can update. With the $20 off coupon, it cost me less than $100. Not bad for a beginner espresso machine owner. I really don't know good from bad, but the espresso in Europe (Italy) has really good flavor. For a first time buyer I would recommend this item. I still have not used the Kcup part as that is mostly for my daughter's use, even though we have a keruig. The unit is compact and therefore does not take up much room. It may have a small water tank, but after 3 espressos, there is still more than 1/2 tank of water left. For now I am very happy with itü§û. The 4 stars are for having to return the first one and then (not company fault) delivery delay.
